intro: Rourea induta f. reticulata, commonly known as the reticulate rourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and dense, often hairy foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color, which are followed by fleshy, berry-like fruits. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its unique leaf patterns and ornamental value make it a subject of interest in botanical gardens and horticultural studies.
